gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour.Contours
Class UnorderedContours

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour.Contours.Contours
      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour.Contours.MixedContours
          gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour.Contours.UnorderedContours
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState
public class UnorderedContours
extends MixedContours

Represents a collection of uniformly spaced contour lines and manually specified contour lines such that the collection is not ordered.

UNIFORM_LEVELS_KEY

public static final java.lang.String UNIFORM_LEVELS_KEY
"Uniform levels" - This static constant String is a key used for referencing the UniformContours in this collection of contour levels. The value that this key references is a UniformContours object.

Constructor Detail

UnorderedContours

public UnorderedContours()
Creates a default collection of uniformly spaced and nonuniformly spaced contour levels where the default constructors of the UniformContours and NonUniformContours classes are used to create the contours.

UnorderedContours

public UnorderedContours(UniformContours uniformLevels,
                         NonUniformContours manualLevels)
Creates a collection of both manually entered and uniformly spaced contour levels where the collection does not contain any duplicate contour levels.

Parameters:
uniformLevels - Represents the uniformly spaced contour levels. If this is null it is ignored.
manualLevels - Represents the manually entered contour levels. If this is null it is ignored.

UnorderedContours

public UnorderedContours(UniformContours uniformLevels,
                         NonUniformContours manualLevels,
                         boolean ignoreRepeats)
Creates a collection of both manually entered and uniformly spaced contour levels.

Parameters:
uniformLevels - Represents the uniformly spaced contour levels. If this is null it is ignored.
manualLevels - Represents the manually entered contour levels. If this is null it is ignored.
ignoreRepeats - If true, the collection of contour levels will not contain any duplicate levels. If false, it may contain duplicates (in the case where the a manually entered level is the same as one of the uniformly spaced contour levels).

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
Used to get the state information for this collection of contour levels.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Overrides:

Parameters:

getLevelAt

public float getLevelAt(int i)
Get the ith contour level.

Specified by:
getLevelAt in class Contours
Parameters:
i - The index of the contour level to reference. For i to be valid it must be in the range [0,Contours.getNumLevels()).
Returns:
The contour level referenced by the given index i or Float.NaN if i is invalid.
